attributes.action: Solution to current Brexit conundrum: Let people decide the terms of Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that the current Parliament passes a law:

(i) to enable a second referrendum setting out the Brexit options for people to vote on; and 

(ii) that binds the Parliament to implement the result of that second referrendum. 

The Brexit options can include inter alia a no deal exit, a customs union and a common market 2.    

If required, the law can set out a reasonable extention to the current Brexit date that allows the above measures to be implemented.
attributes.background: The current Brexit deadlock is unprecedented.   Another election or change in the prime ministership will not resolve the underlying issue that has beseiged the MPs: the deep rooted disagreement as to the best way to implement the result of the first referrendum and the Brexit terms.

rejection.details: We understand you want there to be a second EU referendum but we're not sure exactly what other options you want to be voted on alongside "no deal exit, a customs union and a common market 2."
